questions.question: 1.ATPL_OXFORD
The VDF term meaning ˋtrue bearing from the stationˊ is:
A class B VDF bearing will have an accuracy of:
An error applicable to VDF would be:
The maximum range an ATC facility at 1369 ft AMSL can provide a service to an aircraft at FL350 is:
The Doppler effect is:

options.content: the change in frequency caused by the movement of a transmitter and receiver
the change in frequency caused by the movement of a receiver
the change in frequency caused by the movement of a transmitter
the change in frequency caused by the relative movement between a transmitter and receiver

questions.question: The least accurate bearing information taken by an aircraft over the sea from a NDB will be from:

options.content: a coastal beacon at an acute angle
an inland beacon at an acute angle
a coastal beacon perpendicular to the coast
an inland beacon perpendicular to the coast

questions.question: The accuracy of ADF may be affected by:

options.content: night effect, tropospheric propagation, quadrantal error
static interference, siting errors, slant range
angle of bank, mountain effect, station interference
angle of bank, static from Cb, siting errors

questions.question: The ADF error which will cause the needle to ˋhuntˊ (i.e. oscillate around the correct bearing) is:
The accuracy of ADF by day and excluding compass error is:
A NDB has emission designator N0NA1A this will require the use of the BFO for:
The principle of operation of VOR is:

The pilot of an aircraft flying at FL240 is 250 NM from a VOR at 16 ft AMSL which he selects.

He receives no signal from the VOR. This is because:

options.content: the range of VOR is limited to 200 NM
the aircraft is beyond line of sight range

questions.question:
The phase difference measured at the aircraft from a VOR is 235°.

The bearing of the beacon from the aircraft is:

A pilot intends to home to a VOR on the 147 radial.

The setting he should put on the OBS and the CDI indications will be:

An aircraft is 100 NM SW of a VOR heading 080°.

The pilot intends to home to the VOR on the 210 radial. The setting he should put on the OBS is _____ and the CDI indications will be:

Flying an ILS approach the equipment senses that the 90 Hz modulation predominates on both the localizer and the glide path.

The indications the pilot will see are:
On an ILS approach, using a 3° glide path, the height of an aircraft, ground speed 160 kt, at 3.5 NM from touchdown should be:
A category II ILS facility is required to provide guidance to:
When flying downwind abeam the upwind end of the runway the indications from the ILS on the CDI will be:

options.content: in the correct sense for the localizer and no glide path signal
erratic on both localizer and glide path
erratic on the localizer and in the correct sense on the glide path
no localizer signal and in the correct sense for glide path

questions.question: The azimuth coverage of a 3° glide path is:
The coverage of the approach azimuth and elevation of a MLS is:
A full MLS system comprises a DME and:
MLS has 200 channels available in the frequency band:
The type of radar which has no minimum range restriction is:
The maximum theoretical range of a radar is determined by:

The time interval between the transmission of a pulse and receipt of the echo from a target is 925.5 microseconds.

The range of the target is:
An advantage of a slotted antenna (planar array) over a parabolic reflector are:
The best resolution will be achieved on a radar display with:

options.content: high power output and large parabolic reflector
narrow beamwidth and narrow pulse width
low frequency and small parabolic reflector

questions.question:
A radar transmitting on 600 MHz has a PRF of 300 pps and an aerial rotation rate of 5 rpm.

This radar will be:
The AWR operating frequency is:
The AWR frequency is selected because it gives:
On a colour AWR display, the heaviest precipitation will be displayed in:
The SSR code to select when the aircraft is being unlawfully interfered with is:
In SSR the ground station interrogates the aircraft on _____ MHz and receives replies from the aircraft on _____ MHz
The altitude read-out at the ground station from a mode C response will give the aircraft altitude within:
If the aircraft DME interrogates a ground transponder on a frequency of 1199 MHz, it will look for replies on:
A DME recognizes replies to its own interrogating pulses because:

options.content: each pulse pair has its own unique modulation which is replicated by the transponder
the PRF of the interrogating pulses is jittered
each aircraft has a different time interval within the pulses pairs which is replicated by the transponder
the transponder uses a selective reply system to respond to the aircraft interrogation pulses

questions.question: The DME in an aircraft at FL630 measures a slant range of 16 NM from a ground station at 1225 ft AMSL. The plan range is:
If the identification of a VOR is FKL and the paired DME identification is FKZ, then:

options.content: the beacons are between 600 m and 6 NM apart
the transmitters are in excess of 6 NM apart

questions.question: The NAVSTAR/GPS operational constellation comprises:
The model of the earth used for GPS is:
The major limitation in the use of GPS for precision approaches using wide area augmentation systems (WAAS) is:

options.content: the height difference between the ellipsoid and the earth
global coverage of WAAS is not available
degradation of range measurement because of ionospheric propagation errors

questions.question: The number of SVs required to produce a 3D fix is:
EGNOS provides a WAAS by determining the errors in _____ and broadcasting these errors to receivers using _____

options.content: X, Y & Z coordinates geostationary satellites

questions.question: The principle error in GNSS is:
If the signal from an SV is lost during an aircraft manoeuvre:

options.content: the receiver will select another SV with no loss in accuracy
the receiver will go into a DR mode with no loss of accuracy
the receiver will compensate by using the last calculated altitude to maintain positional accuracy
the receiver position will degrade regardless of the action taken

questions.question: The purpose of the PRN codes in NAVSTAR/GPS is to:

options.content: synchronize the receiver clocks with the SV clocks
pass navigation and system data to the receiver

questions.question: If the receiver almanac becomes corrupted it will download the almanac from the constellation. This download will take:
The provision of RAIM requires a minimum of _____ SVs.
The best position on an aircraft for the GNSS aerial is:

options.content: in the cockpit as close as possible to the receiver
on the fuselage close to the centre of gravity
on the aircraft as far as possible from other aerials to reduce reflections
close to each wing tip to compensate for manoeuvre errors

questions.question: The NAVSTAR/GPS constellation is inclined at _____ to the equator with an orbital period of _____
The NAVSTAR/GPS frequency available to non-authorized users is:
The NAV and system data message is contained in the _____ signal
A 2D RNAV system takes fixing inputs from:
The accuracy required of a basic RNAV system is:

An aircraft using a 2D RNAV system is 23 NM from the waypoint on a 50 NM leg.

The waypoint is 45 NM from the VOR/DME and the aircraft is 37 NM from the VOR/DME.

The range indicated to the pilot will be:
The navigation database in an FMC:

options.content: can be modified by the flight crew to meet the route requirements
can only be read by the flight crew
cannot be accessed by the flight crew

questions.question: The RNAV function of the FMC produces a position which:

options.content: combines the short term accuracy of the external reference with the long term accuracy of the IRS
produces a long term accuracy from the short term accuracy of the external reference and the IRS
produces a long term accuracy from the long term accuracy of the external reference and the IRS
combines the long term accuracy of the external reference with the short term accuracy of the IRS

questions.question: The most accurate external reference position will be provided by:

options.content: Suitable combination of VOR and DME

questions.question:
Refer to Appendix A.

Which diagram shows the MAP display?

Refer to Appendix A, diagram E.

What is the track from BANTU to ZAPPO?

Refer to Appendix A, diagram A.

What is the deviation from the required track?

Refer to Appendix A, diagram F.

What is the required track?

Refer to Appendix A, diagram C.

What is the symbol designated DFC which is coloured cyan?
The FMC position is:

options.content: the selected IRS position updated by external reference using Kalman filtering
derived from IRS and external reference positions using the Kalman filtering process
derived from external reference position and monitored against the IRS position using the Kalman filtering process
the external reference position updated by IRS information through the Kalman filtering process
